ingredients.item: 2 x 300g packs lamb neck fillet, cut into 2-3cm chunks

instructions.step: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large pan. Season the meat and brown in batches; set aside. Add the remaining oil to the pan; cook the onions gently for 10 minutes. Add the carrot, garlic, spices and bay; cook for 2 minutes more. Return the meat and any resting juices along with the wine and tomatoes.
Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and cover; simmer gently for 2 hours. Uncover and cook for 1 hour more, until the lamb is meltingly tender and the sauce is thick and glossy.

Season, then remove and discard the whole spices. Cover; rest for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, boil the pasta in salted water until al dente; drain. Serve the lamb over the pasta; top with parmesan, if liked.
